p: The current clinical standard for CD34 + cell enrichment is optimized for collection of CD34 Hi cells. However, in Patient 1, direct enrichment of CD34 + cells using this protocol was inefficient, resulting in an approximately 3% yield and only 5.34Ã—10 6 total CD34 + cells available for gene transfer ( Table 2). Moreover, the purity of the enriched cell product was only 58.9%, and approximately 47% loss in viable cells was observed during culture and gene transfer. Resulting gene-modified cells retained colony-forming capacity and demonstrated acquired resistance to the potent DNA crosslinking agent MMC following LV-mediated FANCA gene transfer ( Table 3).
